meanings.definition: The quality or state of being luminous.
meanings.sent1: The luminosities of the stars filled the night sky with brightness.
meanings.sent2: The room was filled with the soft luminosities of the glowing lamps.
meanings.sent3: The luminosities of the fireflies made the garden look like a magical place.
meanings.sent4: Her smile had a luminosities that brightened up the entire room.
meanings.sent5: The luminosities of the full moon cast a gentle glow over the landscape.

meanings.definition: The amount or degree of brightness emitted by a celestial body.
meanings.sent1: Astronomers study the luminosities of stars to understand their energy output.
meanings.sent2: The luminosities of the sun vary depending on its position in the sky.
meanings.sent3: The luminosities of the shooting stars amazed the spectators during the meteor shower.
meanings.sent4: The luminosities of distant galaxies can be measured using advanced telescopes.
meanings.sent5: The luminosities of the planets in our solar system differ greatly from one another.

meanings.definition: The property of emitting or reflecting light.
meanings.sent1: The luminosities of the crystals in the sunlight created a beautiful rainbow effect.
meanings.sent2: The luminosities of the mirrors in the room made it appear larger than it was.
meanings.sent3: The luminosities of the disco ball added a fun element to the party.
meanings.sent4: The luminosities of the water droplets on the leaves sparkled in the morning dew.
meanings.sent5: The luminosities of the fire danced and flickered in the darkness of the night.
